flexibleText:
Based on Syntax.fm's episode on the topic. Thank you to @wesbos and @stolinski for producing a quality podcast about web development in general, and for this helpful episode which helped prepare the launch of this checklist application.

This checklist is part of a comprehensive series on critical checklists for web development.

checklistItems.label: Lighthouse
checklistItems.flexibleText: Lighthouse, in Chrome DevTools, is an automated tool for improving the quality of web pages. It has audits for performance, accessibility, progressive web apps, and more.

checklistItems.label: Axe
checklistItems.flexibleText: The Axe browser extensions offer an open source rules library for accessibility testing.

checklistItems.label: SEO Tools
checklistItems.flexibleText:
There are a ton of free and paid SEO tools. Some of these include:

  1. WooRank
  2. Varvy
  3. SEMrush
  4. Found
  5. Screaming Frog SEO Spider

sections.title: Automated Tools
sections.flexibleText: Use auditing tools and let the robots do the work for you.

checklistItems.label: Use Chrome DevTools
checklistItems.flexibleText: Test performance and download speed by enabling the Throttling feature in the Chrome DevTools Network tab.

checklistItems.label: Compress images
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Online services that will help you compress your images:

  1. Cloudinary
  2. imgix
  3. ImageOptim
  4. Squoosh

Software to use in your projects that will compress your images:

  1. imagemin
  2. Webpack image loader
  3. SVGO

checklistItems.label: Minify
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Minification is the process of removing all unnecessary characters from source code without changing its functionality.

Do it online:

  1. JS Uglify and Prettify
  2. UglifyJS3

Include it as a package in your project:

  1. UglifyJS
  2. UglifJS Webpack plugin

checklistItems.label: Code splitting
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Code splitting allows you to split your code into various bundles which can then be loaded on demand or in parallel.

Enabling this will be highly dependent on the particulars of your project.

checklistItems.label: Use Google PageSpeed Insights
checklistItems.flexibleText: PageSpeed Insights analyzes the content of a web page, then generates suggestions to make that page faster.

checklistItems.label: Avoid Service Workers initially
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Service Workers can cache your page and assets. Avoid doing this on launch when you might urgently need to make quick and successive final updates.

Service Workers are discussed on Syntax episode 50 on PWAs.

sections.title: Performance
sections.flexibleText: Remember that not every user is using a reliable high-speed broadband connection. Test your product in speed-challenged environments and then make adjustments where needed.

checklistItems.label: Which browsers do you support?
checklistItems.flexibleText: Test on actual browsers that you intend to support. If you have an existing property online, check your analytics to see which browsers your users are actually using to access your site.

checklistItems.label: Get others to test for you
checklistItems.flexibleText: Ask friends and family to test on their own devices. This will help you get a mix of hardware to test on, and it will also get actual "common users" to test your site or application.

checklistItems.label: Use a testing service
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Use an online testing service to test across various browsers, platforms, and hardware:

  1. BrowserStack
  2. Browsershots
  3. Browserling

checklistItems.label: Bust your cache
checklistItems.flexibleText: After making an update, make sure that you bust your browser cache so that you are testing on the latest version of pages and assets.

sections.title: Browser Compatibility
sections.flexibleText: Perform tests, manually or automated, to make sure that you avoid browser compatibility issues.

checklistItems.label: Scoped manual testing
checklistItems.flexibleText: Manually test the checkout flow and have multiple people test for you.

checklistItems.label: Use package.lock
checklistItems.flexibleText: Avoid security and compatibility issues between development and production by using a package.lock file. This will ensure that the versions of packages used in development are exactly the same as those used in production.

checklistItems.label: Visible company name
checklistItems.flexibleText: Make sure that your company name is listed on customers' credit card bills.

checklistItems.label: Visible phone number
checklistItems.flexibleText: Have a phone number listed for disputes.

sections.title: Sales and Credit Cards
sections.flexibleText: If your site or app performs sales online, these considerations are of the utmost importance since successful sales will be key to determining the success of your overall project.

checklistItems.label: Secure API endpoints
checklistItems.flexibleText: Users will try to abuse everything they can. Do not naively believe that users will not take an interest in being junior Mitnicks, or otherwise that legitimate hackers won't take a crack.

checklistItems.label: Scale up
checklistItems.flexibleText: Scale up your server ahead of time, just in case.

checklistItems.label: Early access, soft launch
checklistItems.flexibleText: Provide early access to a select audience.

checklistItems.label: Check your URLs
checklistItems.flexibleText: Make sure all your URLs are correct and working. Avoid any references to “localhost:3000”, for example.

checklistItems.label: Check for placeholder text, i.e. "lorem ipsum"

sections.title: Content
sections.flexibleText: Errors in this space are easy to make and can easily make your site or app look amateur.

checklistItems.label: Use Axe
checklistItems.flexibleText: Previously mentioned in the automated tools section, it can be stressed enough to take advantage of the Axe tools.

checklistItems.label: Provide alt text
checklistItems.flexibleText: Alternative text provides a textual alternative to non-text content in web pages.

checklistItems.label: Use a color contrast checker
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Web Axe list of tools

Browser add-ons:

  1. Chrome extension: Color Contrast Analyzer
  2. Firefox add-on: WCAG Contrast Checker

checklistItems.label: Lighthouse
checklistItems.flexibleText: Previously mentioned in the automated tools section, this Chrome browser feature also runs test to make sure your site or application meets minimum standards for accessibility.

checklistItems.label: Test tabbing order
checklistItems.flexibleText: Use the site with just your keyboard and make sure you have a good experience, i.e. you can tab through content without any problems.

sections.title: Accessibility
sections.flexibleText: "The power of the Web is in its universality. Access by everyone regardless of disability is an essential aspect." - Tim Berners-Lee, W3C Director and inventor of the World Wide Web

checklistItems.label: Sitemap
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Create a sitemap and upload to:

  1. Google
  2. Bing

checklistItems.label: SEO automated checkers
checklistItems.flexibleText:
1. WooRank
  2. Varvy
  3. SEMrush
  4. Found
  5. Screaming Frog SEO Spider

checklistItems.label: Meta tags
checklistItems.flexibleText: Confirm that your pages have meta tags and that they are optimized.

checklistItems.label: Check heading hierarchy
checklistItems.flexibleText: Make sure that your heading tags are structured in the right hierarchy. Yoast and Woorank provide additional details regarding the importance of your "H" tags.

sections.title: SEO
sections.flexibleText: Search Engine Optimization is important only if you want users to find you organicly.

checklistItems.label: Website Analytics
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Google Analytics is by far the most popular solution, but alternatives exist.

Privacy sensitive alternatives:

  1. Simple Analytics
  2. Fathom Analytics
  3. Matomo

Other options:

  1. Mixpanel
  2. Kissmetrics
  3. Clicky
  4. Plus others

checklistItems.label: Facebook tracking pixel
checklistItems.flexibleText: Helps to track the effectiveness of your advertising on Facebook.

checklistItems.label: Use Drip
checklistItems.flexibleText: Drip is an ecommerce marketing resource.

sections.title: Analytics
sections.flexibleText: Get set up to receive insights on who your users are, when they are visiting and where they are visiting from.

checklistItems.label: Redirects
checklistItems.flexibleText: For example, in Apache use the .htaccess file for redirects where content has moved and users need to be redirected.

checklistItems.label: Use a robots.txt file
checklistItems.flexibleText: You can prevent the indexing of certain pages by using a robots.txt file. This will not guarantee that the content will not be indexed, but all legitimate search engines claim to respect this.

checklistItems.label: Enable gzip
checklistItems.flexibleText: Gzip is a method of compressing files (making them smaller). This allows your web server to load smaller files faster.

checklistItems.label: Enable caching
checklistItems.flexibleText: "Intelligent content caching is one of the most effective ways to improve the experience for your site's visitors. Caching, or temporarily storing content from previous requests, is part of the core content delivery strategy implemented within the HTTP protocol." - Digital Ocean

checklistItems.label: Use a Content Delivery Network (CDN)
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Two popular options are:

  1. Cloudflare
  2. KeyCDN

sections.title: Server Config and Access
sections.flexibleText: Make sure that your server(s) are securely configured and help you to optimize the delivery of your content and assets.

checklistItems.label: Provide documentation on processes
checklistItems.flexibleText: Write up instructions for your client or colleagues that will help them in case they run into any issue with the deployment of your site or app.

checklistItems.label: Deploy and test
checklistItems.flexibleText: It is common practice to deploy to a staging environment first, and then finally test a production build.

checklistItems.label: Remove logs and comments
checklistItems.flexibleText: Remove unwanted logs and error reporting left in production build.

sections.title: Company Processes
sections.flexibleText: Make sure company processes and workflow requirements are adhered to.

checklistItems.label: Update DNS records ahead of time
checklistItems.flexibleText: Do not do a DNS record update right before a launch, the propagation of those records can take up to 48 hours.

checklistItems.label: Thoroughly check access
checklistItems.flexibleText: Check access from different countries. You can use a VPN service for this.

checklistItems.label: Consider edge cases
checklistItems.flexibleText: Consider what different devices, resolutions, and access speeds people are using.
